1 tablespoon olive oil ADVERTISEMENT 2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into chunks ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 onion, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 3 cloves garlic, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1 small butternut squash, peeled and chopped ADVERTISEMENT 1 (15.5 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained and rinsed ADVERTISEMENT 1 carrot, peeled and chopped ADVERTISEMENT 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with juice ADVERTISEMENT 1 (14 ounce) can vegetable broth ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon lemon juice ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon ground coriander ADVERTISEMENT 1 dash cayenne pepper ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 45 m Ready In 1 h Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat, and cook the chicken, onion, and garlic about 15 minutes, until browned. Mix the squash, garbanzo beans, carrot, tomatoes with juice, broth, sugar, and lemon juice into the skillet. Season with salt, coriander, and cayenne pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil, and continue cooking 30 minutes, until vegetables are tender.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/1046252.jpg

1 onion, sliced ADVERTISEMENT 2 cloves garlic, minced (optional) ADVERTISEMENT 2 large carrots, peeled and diced ADVERTISEMENT 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and diced ADVERTISEMENT 1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained and rinsed ADVERTISEMENT 2 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into 2-inch pieces ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon ground turmeric ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon dried parsley ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 25 m Cook 4 h Ready In 4 h 25 m Place the onion, garlic, carrots, sweet potatoes, garbanzo beans, and chicken breast pieces into a slow cooker. In a bowl, mix the cumin, turmeric, cinnamon, black pepper, parsley, and salt, and sprinkle over the chicken and vegetables. Pour in the tomatoes, and stir to combine. Cover the cooker, set to High, and cook until the sweet potatoes are tender and the sauce has thickened, 4 to 5 hours.

Prep 20 m Cook 15 m Ready In 6 h 35 m In a mixing bowl, combine the mixed vegetables, beans, onion, celery and bell pepper. In a small sauce pan, combine vinegar, sugar, mustard and flour. answer_units.title: Whole Wheat and Honey Pizza Dough

content.text: made it  |  428 reviews Recipe by: brookes "Quick, easy, yummy homemade pizza dough, which you can top any way that you like. This makes a thin crust but it can be doubled for a thick crust." Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

1 (.25 ounce) package active dry yeast ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup warm water ADVERTISEMENT 2 cups whole wheat flour ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup wheat germ ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon honey ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 10 m Ready In 20 m Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a small bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water. Let stand until creamy, about 10 minutes. In a large bowl combine flour, wheat germ and salt. Make a well in the middle and add honey and yeast mixture. Stir well to combine. Cover and set in a warm place to rise for a few minutes. Roll dough on a floured pizza pan and poke a few holes in it with a fork. Bake in preheated oven for 5 to 10 minutes, or until desired crispiness is achieved.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/490284.jpg

2 cups red lentils ADVERTISEMENT 1 large onion, diced ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon vegetable oil ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons curry paste ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon curry powder ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon ground turmeric ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon ground cumin ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon chili powder ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon white sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon minced garlic ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon minced fresh ginger ADVERTISEMENT 1 (14.25 ounce) can tomato puree ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 30 m Ready In 40 m Wash the lentils in cold water until the water runs clear. Put lentils in a pot with enough water to cover; bring to a boil, place a cover on the pot, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, adding water during cooking as needed to keep covered, until tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Drain. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir onions in hot oil until caramelized, about 20 minutes. Mix curry paste, curry powder, turmeric, cumin, chili powder, salt, sugar, garlic, and ginger together in a large bowl; stir into the onions. Increase heat to high and cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in the tomato puree, remove from heat and stir into the lentils.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/250x250/328678.jpg

1 tablespoon olive oil or canola oil ADVERTISEMENT 8 large garlic cloves, crushed or minced ADVERTISEMENT 1 medium yellow onion, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 4 cups chopped raw kale ADVERTISEMENT 4 cups low-fat, low-sodium chicken or vegetable broth ADVERTISEMENT 2 (15 ounce) cans white beans, such as cannellini or navy, undrained ADVERTISEMENT 4 plum tomatoes, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 2 teaspoons dried Italian herb seasoning ADVERTISEMENT Salt and pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup chopped parsley ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

In a large pot, heat olive oil. Add garlic and onion; saute until soft. Add kale and saute, stirring, until wilted. Add 3 cups of broth, 2 cups of beans, and all of the tomato, herbs, salt and pepper. Simmer 5 minutes. In a blender or food processor, mix the remaining beans and broth until smooth. Stir into soup to thicken. Simmer 15 minutes. Ladle into bowls; sprinkle with chopped parsley.

2 sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon corn oil ADVERTISEMENT salt and pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT 1 (12 ounce) package frozen corn kernels, thawed ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup water ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon corn oil ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 cups finely diced celery ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup diced red onion ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup shallot, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon tomato paste ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme leaves ADVERTISEMENT 3 cups vegetable broth ADVERTISEMENT 1 bay leaf ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1 potato, peeled and cubed ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 30 m Cook 1 h Ready In 1 h 30 m Preheat an oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Place the sweet potatoes into a 9x13 inch baking dish, drizzle with 1 tablespoon of corn oil, and season with salt and pepper. Stir to coat the sweet potatoes in oil. Roast in the preheated oven until the sweet potatoes are golden and tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Stir occasionally as they cook so the sweet potatoes cook evenly. Meanwhile, measure out 1 cup of corn kernels and set aside. Place the remaining corn into a blender, and puree with the water until smooth; set aside. Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of corn oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the celery, onion, and shallot. Cook and stir until the onion has softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in the tomato paste and dried thyme leaves; cook 1 minute more. Pour in the vegetable broth, corn puree, bay leaf, salt, and cubed potato. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce the heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the potato is tender, 25 to 35 minutes. Once the potato is tender, remove and discard the bay leaf. Stir in the whole corn kernels, sweet potato, and chopped parsley. Return to a simmer and season to taste with salt and pepper before serving.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/782898.jpg

answer_units.title: Spiced Sweet Roasted Red Pepper Hummus

content.text: made it  |  474 reviews Recipe by: MARBALET "Serve with pita bread-you can cut pita bread into wedges and toast it for a different taste sensation. Tahini is a sesame paste, you can usually find it in the Mediterranean section of your grocery store." Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained ADVERTISEMENT 1 (4 ounce) jar roasted red peppers ADVERTISEMENT 3 tablespoons lemon juice ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 tablespoons tahini ADVERTISEMENT 1 clove garlic, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Ready In 1 h 15 m In an electric blender or food processor, puree the chickpeas, red peppers, lemon juice, tahini, garlic, cumin, cayenne, and salt. Process, using long pulses, until the mixture is fairly smooth, and slightly fluffy. Make sure to scrape the mixture off the sides of the food processor or blender in between pulses. Transfer to a serving bowl and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. (The hummus can be made up to 3 days ahead and refrigerated. Return to room temperature before serving.) Sprinkle the hummus with the chopped parsley before serving.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/250x250/17068.jpg

1 tablespoon vegetable oil ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup chopped onions ADVERTISEMENT 3/4 cup chopped carrots ADVERTISEMENT 3 cloves garlic, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup chopped green bell pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup chopped red bell pepper ADVERTISEMENT 3/4 cup chopped celery ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon chili powder ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 cups chopped fresh mushrooms ADVERTISEMENT 1 (28 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes with liquid, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 1 (19 ounce) can kidney beans with liquid ADVERTISEMENT 1 (11 ounce) can whole kernel corn, undrained ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon ground cumin ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 teaspoons dried oregano ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 teaspoons dried basil ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 25 m Cook 30 m Ready In 55 m Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Saute onions, carrots, and garlic until tender. Stir in green pepper, red pepper, celery, and chili powder. Cook until vegetables are tender, about 6 minutes. Stir in mushrooms, and cook 4 minutes. Stir in tomatoes, kidney beans, and corn. Season with cumin, oregano, and basil. 1/2 cup unpopped popcorn ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon vegetable oil ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon salt, or to taste ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 2 m Cook 3 m Ready In 5 m In a cup or small bowl, mix together the unpopped popcorn and oil. Pour the coated corn into a brown paper lunch sack, and sprinkle in the salt. Fold the top of the bag over twice to seal in the ingredients. Cook in the microwave at full power for 2 1/2 to 3 minutes, or until you hear pauses of about 2 seconds between pops. 1 (15.5 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained and mashed ADVERTISEMENT 8 fresh basil leaves, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup oat bran ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup quick cooking oats ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup cooked brown rice ADVERTISEMENT 1 (14 ounce) package firm tofu ADVERTISEMENT 5 tablespoons Korean barbeque sauce ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 3/4 teaspoon garlic powder ADVERTISEMENT 3/4 teaspoon dried sage ADVERTISEMENT 2 teaspoons vegetable oil ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 20 m Cook 10 m Ready In 30 m In a large bowl, stir together the mashed garbanzo beans and basil. Mix in the oat bran, quick oats, and rice; the mixture should seem a little dry. In a separate bowl, mash the tofu with your hands, trying to squeeze out as much of the water as possible. Drain of the water, and repeat the process until there is hardly any water worth pouring off. It is not necessary to remove all of the water. Pour the barbeque sauce over the tofu, and stir to coat. Stir the tofu into the garbanzo beans and oats. Season with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and sage; mix until well blended. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Form patties out of the bean mixture, and fry them in hot oil for about 5 minutes per side. Serve as you would burgers.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/560x315/1073299.jpg

made it  |  23 reviews Recipe by: NATHALIE1 "Delicious salmon cakes made with potatoes and the added color of red bell pepper and green onion. I came up with the idea for this recipe out of pure laziness. I didn't want to wait for potatoes to boil! It turned out great and definitely became the overall favorite. I enjoy a simple garlic mayonnaise to accompany the cakes but you can pretty much use whatever you desire." Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

3 medium potatoes, peeled and shredded ADVERTISEMENT 2 eggs ADVERTISEMENT salt and pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 pound cooked flaked salmon ADVERTISEMENT 3 green onions, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons capers, drained ADVERTISEMENT 1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped ADVERTISEMENT 3/4 cup chopped canned banana peppers ADVERTISEMENT 3/4 cup sliced fresh mushrooms ADVERTISEMENT 3/4 cup dry bread crumbs ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup oil for frying, or as needed ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 25 m Cook 6 m Ready In 31 m Squeeze as much liquid from the potatoes as you can, and place in a large bowl. Beat the eggs with salt, pepper, and Italian seasoning, and mix with the potatoes. Mix in salmon, green onions, capers, red bell pepper, banana peppers, mushrooms and bread crumbs. Form into about 12 patties about 3/4 inch thick. Heat 1/4 inch of oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Fry the patties for about 3 minutes per side, or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels quickly before serving. Try to fry all the patties at one time, otherwise the mixture becomes stiff.
http://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/250x250/54311.jpg

content.text: made it  |  342 reviews Recipe by: BETH4KIDS "White bean soup with spinach and leeks is a delicious and filling soup that is perfect for vegetarians if you use vegetable broth, and quick to make. I've been making this soup for years, but I really craved it when I was pregnant with my fourth child." Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

Prep 10 m Cook 15 m Ready In 25 m Heat olive oil in a large saucepan or soup pot over medium heat. Add the leeks and garlic; saute until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in the chicken broth, cannellini beans, bay leaves and cumin. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, and stir in the couscous. Cover, and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in spinach and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Prep 10 m Cook 20 m Ready In 2 h 30 m Pour the water into a saucepan, and cover with a lid. Bring to a boil over high heat, then pour in the quinoa, recover, and continue to simmer over low heat until the water has been absorbed, 15 to 20 minutes. Scrape into a mixing bowl, and chill in the refrigerator until cold. Once cold, stir in the red bell pepper, yellow bell pepper, red onion, curry powder, cilantro, lime juice, sliced almonds, carrots, and cranberries. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Chill before serving.

6 sweet potatoes, cut into French fries ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons canola oil ADVERTISEMENT 3 tablespoons taco seasoning mix ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 10 m Cook 1 h Ready In 1 h 10 m Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). In a plastic bag, combine the sweet potatoes, canola oil, taco seasoning, and cayenne pepper. Close and shake the bag until the fries are evenly coated. Spread the fries out in a single layer on two large baking sheets. Bake for 30 minutes, or until crispy and brown on one side. Turn the fries over using a spatula, and cook for another 30 minutes, or until they are all crispy on the outside and tender inside. Thinner fries may not take as long.

Prep 15 m Cook 15 m Ready In 30 m In a medium bowl, mix together the paprika, garlic powder, salt, onion powder, thyme, cayenne pepper, and ground black pepper. Set aside about 3 tablespoons of this seasoning mixture for the chicken; store the remainder in an airtight container for later use (for seasoning fish, meats, or vegetables). Preheat grill for medium-high heat. Rub some of the reserved 3 tablespoons of seasoning onto both sides of the chicken breasts. Lightly oil the grill grate. Prep 15 m Cook 15 m Ready In 30 m In a large skillet combine sesame oil, canola oil and chili paste; stir-fry 30 seconds. Add garlic and stir fry an additional 30 seconds. In the emptied pan combine the onion, cabbage, and carrots. Stir-fry until cabbage begins to wilt, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in the remaining soy sauce, cooked noodles, and the chicken mixture to pan and mix to blend. Serve and enjoy!

1 (16 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 green bell pepper, cut into 2 inch pieces ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 onion, cut into wedges ADVERTISEMENT 3 cloves garlic, peeled ADVERTISEMENT 1 egg ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon chili powder ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon cumin ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon Thai chili sauce or hot sauce ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 cup bread crumbs ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 20 m Ready In 35 m If grilling, preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil a sheet of aluminum foil. If baking, preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C), and lightly oil a baking sheet. In a medium bowl, mash black beans with a fork until thick and pasty. In a food processor, finely chop bell pepper, onion, and garlic. Then stir into mashed beans. In a small bowl, stir together egg, chili powder, cumin, and chili sauce. Stir the egg mixture into the mashed beans. Mix in bread crumbs until the mixture is sticky and holds together. Divide mixture into four patties. If grilling, place patties on foil, and grill about 8 minutes on each side. If baking, place patties on baking sheet, and bake about 10 minutes on each side.

1/3 cup uncooked white rice ADVERTISEMENT 2/3 cup water ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon vegetable oil ADVERTISEMENT 4 ounces turkey kielbasa, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 1 onion, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1 carrot, chopped ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes ADVERTISEMENT 6 cups water ADVERTISEMENT 2 cups reduced sodium chicken broth ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup dry lentils ADVERTISEMENT 1 (10 ounce) bag fresh spinach, torn ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT

Prep 15 m Cook 35 m Ready In 50 m In a pot, bring the rice and water to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer 20 minutes. Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat, and cook the turkey kielbasa until lightly browned. Mix in onion and carrot, and season with red pepper. Cook and stir until tender. Pour in the water and broth, and mix in lentils. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and simmer 25 minutes. Stir the cooked rice and spinach into the soup, and continue cooking 5 minutes before serving.
